RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH:
professor associado da Universidade Federal de Minas Gerais desde 2011 e bolsista de produtividade em pesquisa nvel 1D no CNPq .Possui graduao em Bacharelado em Cincia da Computao pela Universidade Federal de Minas Gerais (2002), mestrado em Cincia da Computao pela Universidade Federal de Minas Gerais (2004), mestrado em Computer Science - University of Southern California (2007) e doutorado em Cincia da Computao - University of Southern California (2010). Foi professor visitante na University of Southern California (2018/19). Tem experincia na rea de Cincia da Computao, com nfase em Arquitetura de Sistemas de Computao, atuando principalmente nos seguintes temas: redes de computadores, wireless sensor network, voronoi, robtica, robs roteadores e redes definidas por software.
J publicou em importantes locais como ACM Computing Surveys, Transactions on Mobile Computing, SENSYS, INFOCOM, CoNEXT, ICRA, IROS, Computer Networks.
 editor do Computer Networks.
Guest Editor do Mobile Information Systems - Advances in Mobile Networking for IoT Leading the 4th Industrial Revolution e do Embedded IoT Systems: Network, Platform, and Software.
Google Scholar Public URL: https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=2pp8xosAAAAJ
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN:
Bachelor's at Computer Science from Universidade Federal de Minas Gerais (2002), master's at Computer Science from Universidade Federal de Minas Gerais (2004), master's at Computer Science from University of Southern California (2007) and doctorate at Cincia da Computao from University of Southern California (2010). He was a visiting professor at University of Southern California (2018/19). He is an editor of Computer Networks journal. He has experience in Computer Science, focusing on Computer Systems Architecture, acting on the following subjects: wireless sensor network, wireless networks, software defined networking.
Editor of Mobile Information Systems

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: RoboSense: Cooperao entre Robs Mveis e Redes de Sensores Sem Fio
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Este projeto tem por objetivo investigar o problema da cooperao entre agentes mveis autnomos terrestres e areos e redes de ns sensores sem fio estticas e mveis (RSSFE e RSSFM), levando-se em conta aspectos dinmicos e estocsticos. Trata-se de um problema de grande interesse pela reduo significativa nas restries determinsticas e estticas normalmente impostas em diversas abordagens clssicas na literatura de RSSF. Em um grande nmero de trabalhos tipicamente assume-se que os ns so estticos e a comunicao ocorre de maneira determinstica. Ao se possibilitar o deslocamento do n sensor no ambiente vrias consideraes precisam ser feitas para que o funcionamento correto da rede possa ser garantido. Um dos problemas que naturalmente surge a localizao espacial do n, que ser incerta devido a incertezas de atuao e da prpria medida do deslocamento. Essas incertezas so inerentes aos prprios sensores de posio e atuadores responsveis pelo deslocamento, que tambm so contaminados por rudos. Esse problema insere-de entre os grandes desafios da computao lanados pela SBC que trata dos sistemas disponveis, corretos, seguros, escalveis, persistentes e ubquos.

Como instncia inicial deste projeto, ser tratado o problema de desenvolvimento de um prottipo especfico permitindo o desenvolvimento das redes de sensores aquticas. Tendo em vista a vasta rea de aplicao como explorao de gs e petrleo, monitorao do meio ambiente, controle da qualidade gua, este projeto apresenta uma forte contribuio econmica e social..

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: ROTI - Robtica Teleimersiva
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Este projeto tem por objetivo principal investigar o problema da utilizao de veculos robticos semi-autnomos em procedimentos de inspeo e monitorao de ambientes e estruturas de difcil acesso ao ser humano. Os desafios impostos por esse problema so inmeros cujas abordagens envolvem, alm da Robtica, diversas outras reas do conhecimento. Muito embora os esforos atuais em robtica sejam direcionados para a realizao de tarefas de modo totalmente autnomo, a complexidade envolvida em muitas atividades ainda requer a participao ativa de especialistas, no necessariamente em cooperao com agentes robticos. Idealmente, deseja-se prover a esse especialista uma experincia de interao com ambiente remoto (i.e. remoto no necessariamente apenas quanto distncia fsica, mas quanto possibilidade de acesso) de forma mais natural possvel. Isso requer que o rob que atua em tal ambiente real possua autonomia suficiente para execuo de tarefas como desvio de obstculos, controle de trajetria e capacidade planejamento de movimento (motion planning) para que o posicionamento de sensores da carga paga (payload, ou seja, a instrumentao necessria inspeo) comandado pelo usurio seja adequadamente coordenado com o movimento do veculo robtico. Portanto, grosso modo, o problema apresenta duas facetas principais: i) a obteno eficiente de informao do ambiente remoto e suporte interao fsica com esse ambiente e ii) a disponibilizao ao usurio de um ambiente que lhe propicie a sensao mais realstica possvel de estar interagindo diretamente com o ambiente remoto.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: CyberPhysical AOP
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The goal of this project is the development of Cyber-physical systems that can operate on the concept of always working platform (AOP). The goal is to develop a complete system that includes software and hardware developed, a stack of protocols, with models, devices and energy management. In particular, it is the intention of the group members to produce a platform to operate on different wireless networks and low power consumption.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: The goal of this project is the development of Cyber-physical systems that can operate on the concept of always working platform (AOP). The goal is to develop a complete system that includes software and hardware developed, a stack of protocols, with models, devices and energy management. PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: SiCRA - Sistemas Computacionais para Redes Aquticas
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O objetivo deste projeto desenvolver a pesquisa multidisciplinar em Sistemas Computacionais para Redes Aquticas, causando impacto social, impacto na formao de alunos, interagindo com a comunidade, formando um ncleo de excelncia de pesquisa. O projeto de Sistemas Computacionais para Redes Aquticas ocorre em duas frente principais: atravs do desenvolvimento de hardware e software. O hardware composto por ns sensores que possuem capacidade de sensoriamento, comunicao e processamento. Eles podem medir grandezas fsicas (como temperatura, turbidez, poluio, etc.). Outro hardware uma plataforma computacional que age como interface da rede (n gateway), suportam os ns sensores na gua e fazem a comunicao entre terra e gua. O software formado pela pilha de protocolos que garante a comunicao e permite a troca de dados e a cooperao de entidades computacionais em redes de sensores aquticas, facilitando o trabalho do homem, aumentando sua produtividade e melhorando a qualidade de vida. O mrito intelectual desta proposta aparece na pesquisa fundamental para desenvolver novas teorias, algoritmos, protocolos e ferramentas causando impacto em diversas reas da Cincia. Tendo em vista a vasta rea de aplicao, como monitorao do meio ambiente e controle da qualidade gua, este projeto apresenta uma forte contribuio econmica e social. Alm disso, o projeto apresenta carter multi-disciplinar, envolvendo diversas reas da Cincia como Computao, Redes, Sistemas Embutidos, envolve parcerias interinstitucionais (UFMG, UFV, UFJF)

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: ProgNet: Redes com plano de dados programvel
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: A Internet sofreu grandes modificaes durante os anos, novas aplicaes e servios emergiram com restries em relao ao comportamento da rede (banda larga, atraso e perda de pacotes). Qualidade de Servio (QoS) na Internet tornou-se necessrio para prover um bom funcionamento de aplicaes e servios. Porm, QoS afetado pelo congestionamento da rede devido arquitetura da Internet. Equipamentos de rede com plano de dados programveis so uma soluo para manter QoS e mitigar o congestionamento na rede. Este projeto envolve o paradigma de redes definidas por software (SDN). SDN separa logicamente o plano de dados do plano de controle, e possibilita o processamento de fluxos de modo programvel. O padro OpenFlow atualmente a soluo mais utilizada em SDN mas utiliza um conjunto de campos e aes limitados, dificultando a adoo de novos campos e protocolos. Neste projeto propomos um sistema SDN (roteador e controlador) com o objetivo de utilizar novos campos e protocolos, polticas de controle de congestionamento e medio de mtricas de desempenho da rede, sem a necessidade de recompilar ou reiniciar o roteador quando o gerente altera, em tempo de execuo, a forma como os fluxos devem ser processados. Este sistema permitir o processamento de fluxos SDN independente de protocolo utilizando instrues eBPF geradas a partir de programas C ou P4 criados pelo usurio. Com o novo roteador, tambm proposto uma extenso para o DCTCP. Os prottipos deste sistema sero implementados nas plataformas NetFPGA e Toffino para serem transformados em patentes e produtos tecnolgicos. O projeto proposto baseia-se em desenvolver a pesquisa de um novo sistema com plano de dados programvel para QoS e controle de congestionamento.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: The Internet has undergone major changes over the years where new applications and services have emerged with restrictions on network behavior (bandwidth, delay, and packet loss). Quality of Service (QoS) on the Internet has become necessary to provide a smooth operation of applications and services. Unfortunately, QoS is affected by network congestion due to Internet architecture. Network equipment with programmable data plane are the key to maintaining QoS and avoiding network congestion. This project involves the areas of Software-Defined Networking (SDN). SDN logically separates the data plane from the control plane, and enables the processing of flows in programmable mode. The OpenFlow standard is currently the most commonly used solution in SDN. However, the OpenFlow standard uses a limited set of fields and actions, making it difficult to adopt new fields and protocols. In this project, we propose an SDN system (router and controller) to enable the use of new fields and protocols, congestion control policies, and measurement of network performance metrics, without the need to recompile or restart the router when the user changes at run time how the flows are to be processed. In addition, with the proposed system it will be possible to process protocol-independent SDN streams using eBPF statements generated from user-created C or P4 programs. With the new router, we also propose an extension for DCTCP. The prototypes will be implemented on the NetFPGA and Toffino platforms that can be transformed into patents and technology products. Therefore, in this project, we propose to develop the research of a new system with programmable data plan for QoS and congestion control.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: ProgNet: Networks with programmable data plane

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: SisNet: Sistema de Rede para Computao Serverless
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Serverless um novo paradigma para computao em nuvem. Neste paradigma usurios apenas implementam o ncleo da aplicao sem preocupar com a infraestrutura. Processamento de funes ocorre em servidores com CPUs x86_x64 utilizando virtualizao. Essa abordagem no eficiente, gera atrasos de processamento e sobrecarrega recursos, aumentando o custo operacional. Neste trabalho proposto um sistema Serverless com offloading em hardware que processa pacotes independente de protocolo via programas C eBPF. Para melhorar o desempenho do sistema, realizaremos otimizaes de hardware e integraremos ao OpenFaaS. O objetivo o sistema operar em taxa de linha. Os prottipos deste sistema sero implementados nas plataformas NetFPGA SUME e Toffino para serem transformados em patentes e produtos tecnolgicos. O projeto proposto baseia-se em desenvolver a pesquisa de um novo sistema em redes para melhorar o desempenho da computao em nuvem.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Serverless is a new paradigm for cloud computing. In this paradigm, users only implement the application core without worrying about the infrastructure. Role processing occurs on servers with x86_x64 CPUs using virtualization. This approach is not efficient, it generates processing delays and overloads resources, increasing the operational cost. This work proposes a Serverless system with hardware offloading that processes protocol-independent packets through C and eBPF programs. To improve system performance, we will perform hardware optimizations and integrate with OpenFaaS. The objective is for the system to operate at line rate. The prototypes of this system will be implemented on the NetFPGA SUME and Toffino platforms to be transformed into patents and technological products. The proposed project is based on developing research for a new networked system to improve the performance of cloud computing.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: SisNet: Network System for Serverless Computing

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Computao Alm do Silcio Projeto e Simulao de Circuitos de Quantum-Dots Cellular Automata (QCA)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O objetivo deste projeto de pesquisa investigar e estudar alternativas tecnolgicas que possam ser capazes de substituir os transistores de silcio convencionalmente usados na computao. Mais especificamente, focaremos no projeto e simulao de circuitos de Quantum-Dot Cellular Automata (QCA), uma destas alternativas, que no utilizam transistores e nem corrente eltrica.

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: VIEIRA, M. A. M.;Vieira, Marcos A. M.;Vieira, Marcos A.M.;Marcos Augusto M. Vieira;Vieira, Marcos Augusto M.;VIEIRA, MARCOS;M. VIEIRA, MARCOS A.;MENEZES VIEIRA, MARCOS AUGUSTO;VIEIRA, MARCOS AUGUSTO MENEZES

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: NEW-WIFI: Novos Protocolos para Redes Sem Fio
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Redes de computadores sem fio permitem a todos comunicar e
compartilhar os mais diversos recursos, independentemente da
localizao ou de presena fsica simultnea. Apesar do grande
potencial de aplicaes das RSFs, elas ainda no so eficientes em
termos de energia e vazo de dados. Codificao em Rede uma
tcnica que permite combinar pacotes codificados na rede e prov
ganhos para a rede aumentando a vazo desta, diminuindo o consumo de
energia. Neste projeto, propomos contribuir com a pesquisa de novos
protocolos, utilizando a tcnica de Codificao em Rede, e a
avaliao de seu impacto no desempenho de redes sem-fio. Pretendemos
usar rdios definidos por software para avaliar o impacto no mundo
real. O projeto tem potencial de produto podendo ser utilizado pela
sociedade e empresas, aumentando a vazo de dados e provendo melhor
acesso do cidado brasileiro ao conhecimento.

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: VIEIRA, M. A. M.;Vieira, Marcos A. M.;Vieira, Marcos A.M.;Marcos Augusto M. Vieira;Vieira, Marcos Augusto M.;VIEIRA, MARCOS;M. VIEIRA, MARCOS A.;MENEZES VIEIRA, MARCOS AUGUSTO;VIEIRA, MARCOS AUGUSTO MENEZES

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: SENUREVE: Servios na Nuvem para Redes Veiculares
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Uma VANET (Vehicular Ad-hoc Network) uma rede ad-hoc formada por veculos equipados com dispositivos de processamento, sensoriamento, comunicao sem fio e interfaces homem-mquina. Uma VANET ser um grande passo para a construo de sistemas de transporte inteligentes. A computao em nuvem define um conjunto de recursos virtuais facilmente usveis e acessveis tais como hardware, plataformas de desenvolvimento e servios. Estes recursos podem ser dinamicamente re-configurados para se ajustarem a uma carga varivel, permitindo a otimizao do uso dos recursos. O objetivo desta proposta propor servios de disseminao de informao para passageiros atravs de computao em nuvem.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: IFIP Networking
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: IFIP Networking 2016

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Infrastructure-as-a-Service providers need to provision
and isolate their tenants?s virtual networks. Current network
isolation solutions either suffer from limited scalability, incur
encapsulation overheads, or require advanced (e.g., OpenFlow)
hardware switches. We propose LANES, a system that provides
isolation between billions of virtual machines using commodity
Ethernet switches without encapsulation overheads. LANES
virtualizes each tenant?s network address space and configures
rules on each server to translate (tenant) virtual addresses to
(infrastructure) physical addresses. Virtual address spaces give
tenants flexibility when configuring their virtual networks, and
physical addresses reduce demand on infrastructure switches.
We implement LANES in OpenStack, leveraging OpenStack?s
network description functionalities and using OpenFlow to configure
Open vSwitch on infrastructure servers. Our evaluation
shows LANES ensures network isolation with acceptable rule
configuration latency.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: IEEE Symposium on Computers and Communications
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: IEEE Symposium on Computers and Communications

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Communications using wireless networks have received increasing amount of users and devices. This implies in an increasing need for improvements in wireless networks. IEEE 802.11ac standard enables channels wider than 20 MHz bandwidth. But currently, access points allocate channel bandwidth statically, independent of the clients' configurations. This leads to poor network performance. In this work, we design a system that enables clients to choose the link's bandwidth they connect to the APs. We validate the system through realistic experiments. We show the trade-off between latency and throughput. Our results show that our system improves the frequency spectrum usage.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Dynamic Link Aggregation in Software Defined Networking
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Dynamic Link Aggregation in Software Defined Networking

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: IEEE Symposium on Computers and Communications
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: IEEE Symposium on Computers and Communications

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The link aggregation technique is a solution to the link saturation problem. This technique combines several physical links to create a virtual link with the sum of the respective bandwidths. Since the use of Software Defined Networks (SDN) in enterprise environments increases every day, the purpose of this work is to allow the SDN controller to configure the aggregation of links. Therefore, we have defined and implemented an architecture that it is configurable, scalable, and autonomous, and dynamically aggregates links. Three link aggregation algorithms were evaluated: hash, traffic analysis, and virtual round-robin. Compared with the well known LACP protocol, the proposed system performs a better distribution of the bandwidth, allows more aggregated interfaces, and increases the throughput between two endpoints in our tests.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: COPPER: Increasing Underwater Sensor Network Performance Through Nodes Cooperation
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: COPPER: Increasing Underwater Sensor Network Performance Through Nodes Cooperation

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: IEEE Symposium on Computers and Communications
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: IEEE Symposium on Computers and Communications

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Monitoring underwater environments is still a hard and costly task. Indeed, electromagnetic and optical waves suffer high attenuation, being absorbed in a few meters and even acoustic communication presents low throughput and high bit error rate. Most of the existing approaches to enhance underwater communication performance relies on developing acoustic modems, multiple access to the communication channel and, data routing. In this paper, we present COPPER: a COoperative Protocol for PERvasive Underwater Acoustic Networks. COPPER synchronously/asynchronously works on top of TDMA method combined with an ARQ scheme based on selective repeat technique. It uses idle sensor nodes as relay nodes, enhancing communication space diversity. Our simulations show that, when compared to a non-cooperative protocol, COPPER enhances overall network performance metrics. For instance, it reduces packet error rate by 28.32% and increases goodput by 16.87% while spending less than 1% more energy.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: ACM International Conference on Modeling, Analysis and Simulation of Wireless and Mobile Systems (MSWIM)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: The 21st ACM International Conference on Modeling, Analysis and Simulation of Wireless and Mobile Systems

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Many applications in Wireless Sensor Networks (WSNs) require
collecting massive data in a coordinated approach. To that end, a
many-to-one (convergecast) communication pattern is used in tree-
based WSNs. However, traffic near the sink node usually becomes
the network bottleneck. In this work, we propose an extension to
the 802.15.4 standard for enabling wider bandwidth channels. Then,
we measure the speed of data collection in a tree-based WSN, with
radios operating in these wider bandwidth channels. Finally, we
propose and implement Funneling Wider Bandwidth (FWB), an
algorithm that minimizes schedule length in networks. We prove
that the algorithm is optimal in regard to the number of time slots.
In our simulations and experiments, we show that FWB achieves
a higher average throughput and a smaller number of time slots.
This new approach could be adapted for other relevant emerging
standards, such as WirelessHART, ISA 100.11a and IEEE 802.15.4e
TSCH.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: CoNEXT 2020 - International Conference on emerging Networking EXperiments and Technologies
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the 16th International Conference on emerging Networking EXperiments and Technologies

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Network Functions (NFs) perform on-path processing of network traffic. ISPs are deploying NF Virtualization (NFV) with softwareNFs run on commodity servers. ISPs aim to ensure that NF chains, directed acyclic graphs of NFs, do not violate Service Level Objectives (SLOs) promised by the ISP to its customers. To meet SLOs,NFV systems sometimes leverage on-path hardware (such as programmable switches and smart NICs) to accelerate NF execution.

Lemur places and executes NF chains across heterogeneous hard-ware while meeting SLOs. Lemur?s novel placement algorithm yields an SLO-satisfying NF placement while weighing many constraints: hardware memory and processing stages, server cores, link capacity, NF profiles, and NF chain interactions. Lemur?s meta-compiler automatically generates code and rules (in P4, Python, eBPF, C++, and OpenFlow) to stitch cross-platform NF chain execution while also optimizing resource usage. Our experiments show that Lemur is alone among competing strategies in meeting SLOs for canonical NF chains while maximizing marginal throughput(the traffic rate in excess of the service-level objective).

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: IFIP/IEEE International Symposium on Integrated Network Management (IM)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: IFIP/IEEE International Symposium on Integrated Network Management (IM)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Traffic classification is fundamental to network operators to manage the network better. L7 classification and Deep Packet Inspection (DPI) using regular expressions are vital components to provide application-aware traffic classification. Nevertheless, there are open challenges yet, such as programmability and performance combined with security. In this paper, we introduce eBPFlow, a fast application layer packet classifier in hardware. eBPFlow allows packet classification with DPI on packet headers and payloads in runtime. It enables programming of regular expressions (RegEx) and security protocols using eBPF (extended Berkeley Packet Filter). We built eBPFlow on NetFPGA SUME 40 Gbps and created several application classifiers. The tests were performed in a physical testbed. Our results show that eBPFlow supports packet classification on the application layer with line rate. It only consumes 22 W.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
QUIC protocol is considered an experimental envi-
ronment and a straight forward evolution of the TCP protocol.
Applications created on top of QUIC demonstrate being more
efficient than the regular HTTPS stack. Computational offload
to kernel space is used as performance optimization for modern
applications and brings with it a series of architectural and
algorithmic challenges. This work presents eQUIC Gateway,
a kernel space module that filter packets based on real time
information exchanged with a user space QUIC application.
Throughout kernel offload technique for filtering packets, eQUIC
Gateway increased the packets throughput in 30.9%, reduced
65% of the average HTTPS request duration under attack and
reduced by 26.4% the CPU time consumed for filtering packets.
The source code of eQUIC Gateway is public available on Github

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: 26th IEEE Symposium on Computers and Communications (IEEE ISCC 2021)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Core allocation for application threads is a problem
of reasonable complexity and computational cost inside Unix
systems. Caladan scheduler is a solution aiming to reduce the
cost of how threads and cores are allocated in microsecond scale.
The system Danian optimizes through memoization the thread
picking algorithm that picks the best thread for a given core.
Such improvements has direct impact on applications distributed
across networks on a data center. This operation cost dropped
from O(n) to O(1), the CPU time reduced 7%, the tail latency
reduced 3% on Caladan Synthetic experiment and 5% on the
Netperf experiment

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: TSCH-LBV: Alocaao dinmica de canais com largura de banda varivel em redes TSCH

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XI Simpsio Brasileiro de Engenharia de Sistemas Computacionais
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Anais Estendidos do XI Simpsio Brasileiro de Engenharia de Sistemas Computacionais

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A transmisso e recepo de pacotes em redes sem fio sofre com problemas como interferncia, colises e presena de gargalos, causando o aumento da latncia e diminuio da vazo na rede. A alta demanda por um conjunto de enlaces pode tornar a rede ineficiente e, at mesmo, inoperante. As redes TSCH tentam evitar colises via escalonamento de canais e tempo, no entanto, ainda h a presena de gargalos e um aprimoramento para os escalonamentos tradicionais deve ser fornecido. A largura de banda dos canais pode ser usada para melhorar a vazo em regies com gargalos. Dessa forma, neste artigo propomos a alocao dinmica de canais com largura de banda varivel para reduzir gargalos e aumentar a vazo. A alocao de canais e escalonamento das transmisses so feitos utilizando o mtodo de mapeamento de conflitos, onde so identificados sees de congestionamento de pacotes, em que um conjunto de ns compete pelos mesmos recursos de canal de comunicao e tempo de envio, organizando-os a fim de aprimorar a performance da rede. Neste trabalho propomos um procedimento de alocao de canais com largura de banda proporcional demanda de pacotes por enlace. O algoritmo foi implementado na plataforma ContikiNG. Os resultados mostram a reduo no tempo do slotframe e melhoria na entrega de mensagens.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: eQUIC Gateway: Maximizando a vazo de pacotes do protocolo QUIC atravs de um servio de gateway utilizando eBPF + XDP

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XI Simpsio Brasileiro de Engenharia de Sistemas Computacionais
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Anais Estendidos do XI Simpsio Brasileiro de Engenharia de Sistemas Computacionais

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O protocolo QUIC considerado um ambiente de experimentao e uma evoluo do protocolo TCP. Aplicaes criadas atravs do QUIC em substituio a tradicional pilha HTTPS tem demonstrado ganhos em desempenho. A tcnica de transferncia (offload) de carga computacional para o espao de ncleo utilizada como otimizao em aplicaes modernas e traz consigo desafios arquiteturais e algortmicos. Esse trabalho apresenta o eQUIC Gateway, um mdulo de bloqueio de pacotes em espao de ncleo que utiliza informaes fornecidas por uma aplicao QUIC em espao de usurio em tempo real. Atravs da transferncia (offload) da carga computacional de bloqueio de pacotes para o espao de ncleo, o eQUIC Gateway aumentou a vazo de pacotes em 30,9%, reduziu em 65% a durao mdia em requisies HTTPS sob ataque e reduziu em 26,4% o tempo de CPU para bloquear-se pacotes.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Dyssect: Dynamic Scaling of Stateful Network Functions
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Dyssect: Dynamic Scaling of Stateful Network Functions

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: IEEE International Conference on Computer Communications (INFOCOM)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the IEEE International Conference on Computer Communications (INFOCOM)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Network Function Virtualization promises better utilization of computational resources by dynamically scaling resources on demand. However, most network functions (NFs) are stateful and require state updates on a per-packet basis. During a scaling operation, cores need to synchronize access to a shared state to avoid race conditions and to guarantee that NFs process packets in arrival order. Unfortunately, the classic approach to control concurrent access to a shared state with locks does not scale to today's throughput and latency requirements. Moreover, network traffic is highly skewed, leading to load imbalances in systems that use only sharding to partition the NF states. To address these challenges, we present Dyssect, a system that enables dynamic scaling of stateful NFs by disaggregating the states of network functions. By carefully coordinating actions between cores and a central controller, Dyssect migrates shards and flows between cores for load balancing or traffic prioritization without resorting to locks or reordering packets. Our experimental evaluation shows that Dyssect reduces tail latency up to 32% and increases throughput up to 19.36% when compared to state-of-the-art competing solutions.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: The Tenet architecture for tiered sensor networks
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: The Tenet architecture for tiered sensor networks

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: VIEIRA, M. A. M.;Vieira, Marcos A. M.;Vieira, Marcos A.M.;Marcos Augusto M. Vieira;Vieira, Marcos Augusto M.;VIEIRA, MARCOS;M. VIEIRA, MARCOS A.;MENEZES VIEIRA, MARCOS AUGUSTO;VIEIRA, MARCOS AUGUSTO MENEZES

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Most sensor network research and software design has been guided by an architectural principle that permits multinode data fusion on small-form-factor, resource-poor nodes, or motes. While we were among the earliest promoters of this approach, through experience we found that this principle leads to fragile and unmanageable systems and explore an alternative. The Tenet architecture is motivated by the observation that future large-scale sensor network deployments will be tiered, consisting of motes in the lower tier and masters, relatively unconstrained 32-bit platform nodes, in the upper tier. Tenet constrains multinode fusion to the master tier while allowing motes to process locally-generated sensor data. This simplifies application development and allows mote-tier software to be reused. Applications running on masters task motes by composing task descriptions from a novel tasklet library. Our Tenet implementation also contains a robust and scalable networking subsystem for disseminating tasks and reliably delivering responses. We show that a Tenet pursuit-evasion application exhibits performance comparable to a mote-native implementation while being considerably more compact. We also present two real-world deployments of Tenet system: a structural vibration monitoring application at Vincent Thomas Bridge and an imaging-based habitat monitoring application at James Reserve, and show that tiered architecture scales network capacity and allows reliable delivery of high rate data.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Hybrid multicriteria algorithms applied to structural design of wireless local area networks
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Hybrid Multicriteria Algorithms Applied to Structural Design of Wireless Local Area Networks

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This manuscript presents a novel approach based on hybrid optimization techniques for planning Wireless Local Area Networks in two stages: i) network structure design for access point (AP) placement and channel assignment and ii) channel assignment enhancement. We consider two objective functions: network load balance and signal-to-interference-plus-noise ratio; and three hard constraints: maximum AP capacities, client demand attendance, and minimum coverage levels. The proposed algorithm delivers an approximation of the efficient solution set, considering the two functions described above. The results from two scenarios were compared to the following four approaches: two multiobjective evolutionary algorithms, a well-known commercial tool, and a greedy technique. Finally, the solutions were subjected to sensitivity analysis to validate their robustness regarding user mobility and AP failures.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Fast Packet Processing with eBPF and XDP
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Fast Packet Processing with eBPF and XDP

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Extended Berkeley Packet Filter (eBPF) is an instruction set and an execution environment inside the Linux kernel. It enables modification, interaction, and kernel programmability at runtime. eBPF can be used to program the eXpress Data Path (XDP), a kernel network layer that processes packets closer to the NIC for fast packet processing. Developers can write programs in C or P4 languages and then compile to eBPF instructions, which can be processed by the kernel or by programmable devices (e.g., SmartNICs). Since its introduction in 2014, eBPF has been rapidly adopted by major companies such as Facebook, Cloudflare, and Netronome. Use cases include network monitoring, network traffic manipulation, load balancing, and system profiling. This work aims to present eBPF to an inexpert audience, covering the main theoretical and fundamental aspects of eBPF and XDP, as well as introducing the reader to simple examples to give insight into the general operation and use of both technologies.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: BloomTime: space-efficient stateful tracking of time-dependent network performance metrics
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: BloomTime: space-efficient stateful tracking of time-dependent network performance metrics

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Network monitoring is essential to tasks ranging from planning to troubleshooting. Unfortunately, comprehensive real-time monitoring of complex networks with large traffic volume is challenging. In particular, tracking of time-dependent metrics, such as round-trip latency or transmission rate requires maintaining state and this is hard to scale. We propose BloomTime: a network monitoring primitive in hardware that employs standard bloom filters to approximately track the times between packets. We have prototyped BloomTime on the NetFPGA platform. As a use case, we use BloomTime to monitor the mean and variance of packet inter-arrival times. We have compared BloomTime against end-host measurements and a centralized solution using classic stateful monitoring. We show that BloomTime can monitor 70 times more flows than the traditional stateful approach with approximation errors below 20%. BloomTime was validated in a realistic test environment using real traces. We show that BloomTime can monitor simultaneously 2000 flows on the NetFPGA 1G board (first generation) with 4 MB of SRAM.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: CAPTAIN: A Data Collection algorithm for underwater optical-Acoustic sensor networks
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: CAPTAIN: A Data Collection algorithm for underwater optical-Acoustic sensor networks

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Underwater sensor networks are used to collect data from aquatic environments. Nodes from these networks usually communicate via acoustic or optical transmissions due to the poor performance of radiofrequency communication in these environments. Acoustic transmissions achieve longer distances than optical ones, but also consume more energy and have lower bandwidth. Underwater optical-acoustic sensor networks (UOASNs) combine both types of communication to explore the best of each one. In this paper, we propose CAPTAIN, an algorithm to perform data collection with data aggregation in UOASNs. CAPTAIN divides the network into clusters, builds a routing tree, and uses data aggregation to deliver all data collected to the sink node. Experiments showed that, compared to the shortest path algorithm, CAPTAIN led to lower network energy consumption, especially in denser networks, where it was able to consume, on average, up to 73% less. CAPTAIN could also achieve lower average latencies (up to almost 83% lower) and higher rates of data collected per hour by the sink node using fewer acoustic transmissions in clustered networks.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Wireless control using reinforcement learning for practical web QoE
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Wireless control using reinforcement learning for practical web QoE

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Wireless networks show several challenges not found in wired networks, due to the dynamics of data transmission. Besides, home wireless networks are managed by non-technical people, and providers do not implement full management services because of the difficulties of manually managing thousands of devices. Thus, automatic management mechanisms are desirable. However, such control mechanisms are hard to achieve in practice because we do not always have a model of the process to be controlled, or the behavior of the environment is dynamic. Thus, the control must adapt to changing conditions, and it is necessary to identify the quality of the control executed from the perspective of the user of the network service. This article proposes a control loop for transmission power and channel selection, based on Software Defined Networking and Reinforcement Learning (RL), and capable of improving Web Quality of Experience metrics, thus benefiting the user. We evaluate a prototype in which some Access Points are controlled by a single controller or by independent controllers. The control loop uses the predicted Mean Opinion Score (MOS) as a reward, thus the system needs to classify the web traffic. We proposed a semi-supervised learning method to classify the web sites into three classes (light, average and heavy) that groups pages by their complexity, i.e. number and size of page elements. These classes define the MOS predictor used by the control loop. The proposed web site classifier achieves an average score of , classifying 500 unlabeled examples with only fifteen known examples, with a sub-second runtime. Further, the RL control loop achieves higher Mean Opinion Score (up to 167% in our best result) than the baselines. The page load time of clients browsing heavy web sites is improved by up to 6.6x

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Optimal transmission range and charging time for Qi-Compliant systems
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Optimal transmission range and charging time for Qi-Compliant systems

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Although widespread in the market, the Wireless
Power Transfer devices following the Qi Standard suffer from
limited transmission range and link instability. Previous works
often address these issues by proposing improvements for both
transmitting and receiving sides, which disposes of the Qi
interoperability and ease of purchasing. This work proposes
an optimal transmitting-range-maximization algorithm for the
receiving part of a Qi-compliant system. The algorithm actuates
over the receiving circuit by dynamically adjusting its internal
impedance. The proposed method obtains the optimal result in
O(1) time and does not require any direct information from the
transmitting part neither any pre-parametrized data. Simulation
results indicate that the proposed algorithm can mitigate the issue
of re-establishing the link when the coils are loosely-coupled.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Performance evaluation of <scp>AODV</scp> over <scp>CSMA</scp> and <scp>TSCH</scp>
Intra and inter-flow link aggregation in SDN
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Intra and inter-flow link aggregation in SDN

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Link saturation is a problem in computer networks. We propose a link aggregation solution that is robust and solves this problem. The approach consists of creating a virtual link by combining multiple physical interfaces, summing up their bandwidth. Besides increasing the data transmission throughput, this type of solution enables a fast and clear repair in the case of link unavailability. Since Software-Defined Networking usage is increasing daily in business scenarios, this work demonstrates a way to create link aggregation in such situations. This led to the improvement of services availability, among many advantages. To achieve that, we defined and implemented a system with self-adaptive link aggregation. We study the intra-flow and inter-flow link aggregation. To evaluate the implementation, we created three algorithms under different conditions: Virtual Round-Robin, Traffic Analysis, and Hash Table. We evaluated the three algorithms in real-world and virtual scenarios. We used the Ryu controller and, for packet switching, the OVS (Open vSwitch) and BPFabric. Virtual Round-Robin achieved 95% of fairness and Hash Table provided higher throughput.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: On Braess's Paradox and Routing Algorithms
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: On Braess's Paradox and Routing Algorithms

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In road traffic networks, famous Braess's Paradox demonstrated that the addition of resources can cause the traffic network performance to decrease. The addition of a new route can cause drivers to use this new road and end up reaching a Nash equilibrium which increases the overall travel time. Unlike previous studies that have investigated the paradox in the context of game theory, road traffic network, and latency edge data network, in this paper we show the novel issue of how the addition of resources can lead to a decrease in data network performance while using certain routing algorithm (i.e shortest widest path - used for quality-of-service routing, quickest path, geographic routing, quality-of-service energy-aware routing), without even considering congestion. We demonstrate the idea for any network size and describe the fundamental issue. Finally, we describe solutions based on current network's technology.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-CAPITULO.TITULO-DO-CAPITULO-DO-LIVRO: NetFPGA: Processamento de Pacotes em Hardware

DETALHAMENTO-DO-CAPITULO.TITULO-DO-LIVRO: Simpsio Brasileiro de Redes de Computadores e Sistemas Distribudos 2015 - Minicursos Livro Texto

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
The NetFPGA platform allows general-purpose network packet processing in hardware.
NetFPGAs can be used to develop research prototypes and deploy new network
functionality. This tutorial will present NetFPGA?s hardware architecture, its programming
interface, and possible applications. We will demonstrate all steps in the implementation
and deployment of a hardware firewall to filter packets depending on the TCP
destination port. The concepts covered in this tutorial will help researchers and programmers
use the NetFPGA with any of its available modules as well as develop new hardware
packet processing modules.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-CAPITULO.TITULO-DO-CAPITULO-DO-LIVRO: Introduo a Rdios Definidos por Software com aplicaes em GNU Radio
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-CAPITULO.TITULO-DO-CAPITULO-DO-LIVRO-INGLES: Introduction to Software Defined Radios including GNURadio applications

DETALHAMENTO-DO-CAPITULO.TITULO-DO-LIVRO: Simpsio Brasileiro de Redes de Computadores e Sistemas Distribudos 2015 - Minicursos Livro Texto

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Software-defined radios (SDR) allow reducing the amount of communication functions
implemented in hardware. Thus, the communication devices become more flexible and
easy to be programmed. SDRs are used in experimental research in Computer Networks,
as well as prototyping and fast deployment of new communication technologies. This
course covers introductory concepts of SDR and GNU Radio platform. The course shows
the basic concepts of wireless communications and digital transmissions, focusing on
the data link layer. Practical applications of SDR, focused on experimental research on
wireless networks, such as proposing new modules for GNU Radio, are demonstrated.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-CAPITULO.TITULO-DO-CAPITULO-DO-LIVRO: Experimental Wireless Research Using Software-Defined Radios
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-CAPITULO.TITULO-DO-CAPITULO-DO-LIVRO-INGLES: Experimental Wireless Research Using Software-Defined Radios

DETALHAMENTO-DO-CAPITULO.TITULO-DO-LIVRO: Simpsio Brasileiro de Redes de Computadores e Sistemas Distribudos 2017 - Minicursos Livro Texto

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Thanks to the popularization of software-defined radios (SDR), it is possible today to perform high-quality research in wireless protocols in real deployments. Although this technology is still a bit expensive, there are a number of initiatives that provide free access to SDR for research. Further, the number of free software libraries available for SDR has reduced the amount of effort required to conduct research using SDR. This short course will show by examples how to perform experimental research in wireless networking using software-defined radios that are available for free on open testbeds being developed on FUTEBOL, a joint Brazil-European Union project. We will adopt a hands-on approach, in which the students will perform many small assignments on real hardware. Those assignments will demonstrate the maturity of SDR for research in wireless networking, and introduce the user to the many software tools and open source implementations of a variety of wireless standards.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
The proliferation of smart objects with capability of sensing, processing and communication
has grown in recent years. In this scenario, the Internet of Things (IoT) connects
these objects to the Internet and provides communication with users and devices. IoT
enables a huge amount of new applications, with which academics and industries can
benefit, such as smart cities, health care and automation. On the other hand, there are several
social, theoretical and practical issues we need to address. To answer these issues,
we need to overcome some challenges like dealing with objects? constraints (e.g., processing,
memory and energy supply), limited bandwidth and hardware dimension. Thus, we
need to explore new communication paradigms, protocols including questions about IP
addressing and adaptations to interoperate with the Internet, hardware architecture and
software design. Besides that, IoT applications need to deal with the process of collecting,
storing, processing and extracting knowledge from data obtained from the smart objects.
The goal of this chapter is to describe the state-of-the-art of IoT by discussing theoretical
and practical questions.

REGISTRO-OU-PATENTE.TITULO-PATENTE: DISPOSITIVO E MTODO PARA MEDIR A TEMPERATURA DE RECIPIENTES, COMPARAR OS DADOS E SELECIONAR
REGISTRO-OU-PATENTE.INSTITUICAO-DEPOSITO-REGISTRO: INPI - Instituto Nacional da Propriedade Industrial

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
A presente tecnologia trata de um dispositivo que mede a
temperatura de recipientes em um sistema e compara os dados,
indicando qual recipiente apresenta a temperatura mais baixa ou
quais recipientes apresentam a temperatura desejada. A indicao
pode ser feita por luz (led), ou por mensagem via internet ou rede
local (ex: Bluetooth). O dispositivo pode ser incorporado a
eletrodomsticos, como geladeiras e freezers, ou ambientes
fechados, como vasilhas ou isopores. Pode ser usado para identificar
a temperatura de recipientes contendo bebidas, vacinas, remdios
ou outros produtos.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-PATENTE.TITULO: DISPOSITIVO DE REDE E MTODO PARA PROCESSAR O TRFEGO DE REDE COM ESTRUTURA SDN DE MODO DINMICO E INDEPENDENTE DE PROTOCOLO

REGISTRO-OU-PATENTE.TITULO-PATENTE: DISPOSITIVO DE REDE E MTODO PARA PROCESSAR O TRFEGO DE REDE COM ESTRUTURA SDN DE MODO DINMICO E INDEPENDENTE DE PROTOCOLO
REGISTRO-OU-PATENTE.INSTITUICAO-DEPOSITO-REGISTRO: INPI - Instituto Nacional da Propriedade Industrial

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
A tecnologia proposta apresenta um dispositivo de rede SDN
(Software-Defined Networking, ou Rede Definida por Software)
implementado em hardware e um mtodo para processar o trfego
em um dispositivo de rede com estrutura SDN de modo dinmico e
independente de protocolo. Prope-se uma arquitetura a ser aplicada
em um dispositivo de rede, este utiliza instrues eBPF (extended
Berkeley Packet Filter) geradas a partir de programas em linguagem
C ou P4 criados pelo usurio. Os efeitos tcnicos alcanados pela
tecnologia proposta so: 1) Plano de dados totalmente programvel
via plano de controle (espao do usurio) sem o usurio ter
conhecimento em programao em hardware. 2) Possibilidade de
utilizao de novos campos e protocolos definidos dinamicamente,
sem a necessidade de recompilar ou reiniciar o roteador quando o
usurio altera, em tempo de execuo, a forma como os fluxos
devem ser processados, propiciando um tempo de inatividade zero
do dispositivo. O dispositivo proposto tambm pode ser usado como
switch ou interface de rede.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Trata-se a presente inveno de um Processo de Roteamento
Dinmico por Meio de Mltiplos Saltos em Redes de Comunicao
por Luz Visvel a ser realizado em 3 trs etapas, quais sejam: 1.
Descoberta das Rotas, 2. Construo de Rotas, e 3. Deteco de
rotas quebradas, em redes de comunicao por luz visvel e tem por
objetivo aumentar o desempenho e permitir comunicao
intermitente de sistemas de comunicao por luz visvel em
ambientes dinmicos, reagindo s interrupes de comunicao fim-a-
fim imposta por obstculos, sombras ou mobilidade, construindo
rotas alternativas na rede de luz visvel, sem a necessidade de
prvio conhecimento da topologia da rede e/ou at mesmo dos
dispositivos que a compem.

DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: IFIP/IEEE International Symposium on Integrated Network Management (IM)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Traffic classification is fundamental to network operators to manage the network better. L7 classification and Deep Packet Inspection (DPI) using regular expressions are vital components to provide application-aware traffic classification. Nevertheless, there are open challenges yet, such as programmability and performance combined with security. In this paper, we introduce eBPFlow, a fast application layer packet classifier in hardware. eBPFlow allows packet classification with DPI on packet headers and payloads in runtime. It enables programming of regular expressions (RegEx) and security protocols using eBPF (extended Berkeley Packet Filter). We built eBPFlow on NetFPGA SUME 40 Gbps and created several application classifiers. The tests were performed in a physical testbed. Our results show that eBPFlow supports packet classification on the application layer with line rate. It only consumes 22 W.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Traffic classification is fundamental to network operators to manage the network better. L7 classification and Deep Packet Inspection (DPI) using regular expressions are vital components to provide application-aware traffic classification. Nevertheless, there are open challenges yet, such as programmability and performance combined with security. In this paper, we introduce eBPFlow, a fast application layer packet classifier in hardware. eBPFlow allows packet classification with DPI on packet headers and payloads in runtime. It enables programming of regular expressions (RegEx) and security protocols using eBPF (extended Berkeley Packet Filter). We built eBPFlow on NetFPGA SUME 40 Gbps and created several application classifiers. The tests were performed in a physical testbed. Our results show that eBPFlow supports packet classification on the application layer with line rate. It only consumes 22 W.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
O projeto de uma Rede de Sensores Sem Fio depente muito da aplicao. Para aplicaes
tradicionais, como monitorao ambiental, smart buildings ou na agricultura,
foram sempre priorizadas a reduo do custo das plataformas, o gasto de energia e o uso
de memria, em troca de ter uma vazo mais baixa. Aplicaes modernas, como sistemas
de segurana ou monitoramento de trfego, geralmente exigem o uso de cmeras
e transmisso de dados de vdeos pela rede. Para aplicaes como essas, plataformas de
dois rdios foram desenvolvidas, onde o seu projeto prioriza alcanar uma vazo maior
e conservar a eficincia energtica da rede. Nesse trabalho proposto um algoritmo de
roteamento multicaminho para encontrar dois caminhos disjuntos com a mesma paridade
entre um par de ns da rede. O novo algoritmo de roteamento, combinado com
um esquema de encaminhamento de pacotes que alterna os rdios ao longo do caminho,
permite que todos os ns usem os dois rdios que possuem em paralelo a todo o
tempo, dobrando a vazo em comparao com um esquema de um nico caminho. Ns
avaliamos nosso algoritmo e esquema de encaminhamento em um testbed fsico contendo
100 ns da plataforma Opal, que possui dois rdios. Nosso protocolo conseguiu
dobrar a vazo em comparao com o FastForward, o protocolo estado-da-arte para
plataformas com dois rdios, e conseguiu atingir at 96% do limite terico
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
The design of a Wireless Sensor Network depends significantly on the application. For
the traditional applications, such as environmental monitoring, smart buildings or agriculture,
the design prioritized reducing the cost, the energy expenditure and memory
usage at the expense of not having a higher throughput. Modern applications, such as
surveillance or traffic monitoring, usually require using cameras and transmitting video
data through the network. For such applications, dual-radio platforms were developed
where their design prioritizes achieving higher throughput and conserve the energy
efficiency of the network. In this work, we propose a multipath routing algorithm to
find two disjoint paths with the same parity between a pair of nodes in the network.
The new routing algorithm, combined with a forwarding scheme that alternates the
radios throughout the paths, allows all nodes in the paths to use both radios in parallel
all the time, doubling the throughput in comparison with a single path routing
scheme. We evaluated our algorithm and forwarding scheme in a real world testbed
with 100 nodes of the Opal dual-radio platform for WSNs. Our scheme were able to
double the throughput when compared with FastForward, the state-of-the-art protocol
for dual-radio platforms, and achieve up to 96% of the theoretical limit.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-PARTICIPACAO-EM-BANCA-D.TITULO: FWB: ALGORITMO PARA COLETA DE DADOS EM REDES COM CANAIS COM MAIOR LARGURA DE BANDA
UBIQUITOUS WIRELESS POWER TRANSFER FOR MULTIPLE MOBILE DEVICES

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Teoria Eletromagnetica, Microondas, Propagao de Ondas, Antenas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
The charging of wireless devices using inductive power transfer has gained prominence

in recent years with the creation of beam-forming techniques using systems with mul-
tiple inputs and multiple outputs. However, previous work aimed at optimizing these

applications is, in general, focused on power transmission, leaving aside aspects of
the battery charging process and energy consumption by the devices. In this work,

we propose two new computational problems associated with the charging of wire-
less devices using wireless power transfer via magnetic induction, enabling ubiquitous

charging, meaning the user does not need to know how and when the devices are
charged. The Minimum-Time MIMO Charging Problem consists of finding voltage

time-series for each transmitting device to finish charging all nodes as soon as pos-
sible. The No-Starvation MIMO Charging Problem, in turn, consists of determining

the voltage time-series to ensure that all devices remain alive within a time window.

We prove the decision versions of both problems as being NP-Complete and we pro-
pose three dynamic-programming algorithms to solve them in linear time regarding the

duration of the time window. We also propose three greedy algorithms as heuristics
for the problems. We describe an algorithm to generate random test instances with a
guaranteed solution and parametrizable difficulty. Experiments indicate that for ?easy
instances? the best dynamic-programming algorithm among those proposed reaches
97% of effectiveness, while the best greedy reaches 92%. For ?difficult instances?, in
turn, the effectiveness rates are 89% and 74%, respectively.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-PARTICIPACAO-EM-BANCA-D.TITULO: Data Collection and Medium Access Control Slutions for Underwater Wireless Sensor Networks
DADOS-BASICOS-DA-PARTICIPACAO-EM-BANCA-D.TITULO-INGLES: Data Collection and Medium Access Control Slutions for Underwater Wireless Sensor Networks

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Underwater wireless sensor networks (UWSNs) can enable lots of scientific, commercial,
and military applications in underwater environments. However, the technology is not
mature yet. Nodes from UWSNs usually communicate through acoustic or optical
transmissions due to the poor performance of radiofrequency (RF) communication in
these environments. The use of these communication technologies, together with the
characteristics of underwater environments, introduces many challenges for UWSNs.
This dissertation provides solutions for two existing problems in UWSNs. Its first
part addresses the problem of collecting data from underwater optical-acoustic sensor
networks (UOASNs), a subset of UWSNs whose nodes can communicate using both
acoustic and optical transmissions. We propose CAPTAIN, a solution that explores
the best of each communication technology to improve data collection in UOASNs.
CAPTAIN is an algorithm that logically divides a UOASN into clusters, establishes a
routing tree, and uses data aggregation to deliver all data collected to the sink node.
Through simulations, we evaluate CAPTAIN by comparing it to the shortest path
algorithm.
In the second part of this dissertation, we address the problem of medium access
control (MAC) in underwater acoustic sensor networks (UWASNs), a subset of UWSNs
whose nodes communicate using acoustic technology. We propose a MAC protocol
for UWASNs called UW-SEEDEX. The protocol employs random time slot schedules
that are driven by pseudorandom number generations and produced from seeds. This
method allows nodes to predict each other?s entire schedules just by exchanging their
seeds, so they can better plan their transmissions to avoid collisions. We use simulations
to evaluate how each of UW-SEEDEX?s parameter affects its performance and how the
protocol performs against MAC solutions from the literature.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-PARTICIPACAO-EM-BANCA-D.TITULO: Chaining-Box: A Transparent SFC Architecture Leveraging BFP
DADOS-BASICOS-DA-PARTICIPACAO-EM-BANCA-D.TITULO-INGLES: Chaining-Box: A Transparent SFC Architecture Leveraging BFP

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
The development and adoption of Network Function Virtualization (NFV) has
allowed great improvements in the way network services are deployed and managed
by service providers. It has enabled the design of infrastructures more capable of
responding to quick changes in demand due to the dynamic nature of traffic, while also
providing reduction in management costs.
In this setting, it is often required to compose different Service Functions (SF)
in a sequential manner to create complex network services that operate on incoming

traffic. Several approaches to handle this interconnection, also called Service Func-
tion Chaining (SFC), have been proposed in recent years, including high-performance

implementations used in production systems.

However, a careful analysis of these proposals shows that the separation of con-
cerns between the service and data planes has not been among the main design ob-
jectives. As a consequence, the existing SFC architectures are tailor-made for specific

environments and platforms, often relying on specialized or modified network devices,
either in software or in hardware.
This work proposes a new SFC architecture called Chaining-Box. It is based on
a simple idea: integrating all functionality needed to provide SFC into each SF as a set
of processing stages. This is done in a fully transparent manner, requiring little to no
support from the underlying infrastructure and without any modifications to functions.
The stages are implemented as BPF programs running inside a Linux kernel to provide
all SFC actions as the packets traverse the kernel stack.
Chaining-Box in detail, presenting its design and discussing how it compares to

other existing SFC implementations, highlighting its advantages and also the disad-
vantages. An experimental analysis is also presented to demonstrate its applicability

and the performance of the prototype implemented.
